title: Senior Optometrist
description:
## :scroll: Job Brief
> We are looking for an Optometrist to perform eye tests and provide excellent eye care to our patients.

### :clipboard: Responsibilities
- :check: Perform comprehensive eye and vision tests
- :check: Diagnose defects of the eye, such as myopia, astigmatism and glaucoma
- :check: Provide personalized temporary and permanent solutions to sight issues based on each patient’s specific case and medical history
- :check: Prescribe medications, eyeglasses and contact lenses
- :check: Advise patients on proper eye care techniques
- :check: Keep updated and accurate medical records for all patients
- :check: Book next appointments in cases where re-examination is required
- :check: Train patients on how to use and maintain their contact lenses
- :check: Refer eye doctors and ophthalmologists when patients need to undergo a surgery or in cases of severe eye injuries

### :white_check_mark: Requirements and skills
- :check: Work experience as an Optometrist
- :check: In-depth understanding of eye conditions and vision defects
- :check: Hands-on experience with eye examination tools, such as ophthalmoscope and tonometer
- :check: The ability to explain medical terms simply and calmly
- :check: Attention to detail
- :check: Degree in Optometry
- :check: Need to know couselling on Lasik
- :check: Experience : 2 year[Min]

> **Language known :** Tamil and English
> **Preferrence:** Dharmapuri Candidates & if Others ready to relocate within 15 days.[ only senior who have more than 2+ years experience in the Optometry]
> **No accommodation**

### :moneybag: Salary and Benefits
| Job Type | Pay | Benefits |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Full-time, Permanent | ₹20,000.00 - ₹22,000.00 per month | Provident Fund |

### :truck: Commute/Relocation
> Dharmapuri, Tamil Nadu: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

### :briefcase: Experience
> total work: 2 years (Required)

title: Senior Optometrist Jobs in Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute - Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu
location: Tiruppur - Palladam Rd, opp. Sulochana Mills, TML Colony, Thennampalayam, Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu 641604, India
description:
## :scroll: Job Description
> Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute is seeking a skilled and experienced Senior Optometrist to join our healthcare team in Tiruppur, Tamil Nadu. As a Senior Optometrist, you will play a vital role in delivering quality eye care services, performing vision assessments, prescribing corrective lenses, and educating patients. At Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute, we are committed to clinical excellence and compassionate patient care.

### :clipboard: Responsibilities
- :check: Conduct comprehensive eye examinations and vision testing at Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute.
- :check: Prescribe eyeglasses and contact lenses based on accurate diagnoses.
- :check: Educate patients on eye health, visual hygiene, and treatment plans.
- :check: Provide pre-operative and post-operative care for surgical patients.
- :check: Maintain and manage accurate patient records and billing information.
- :check: Assist in mentoring junior optometrists at Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute.
- :check: Collaborate with ophthalmologists and other medical staff for holistic eye care.

### :white_check_mark: Requirements
- :check: Bachelor’s degree in Optometry or equivalent qualification.
- :check: Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in optometry.
- :check: Proficient in vision testing, lens fitting, and patient counseling.
- :check: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- :check: Strong decision-making ability and attention to detail.
- :check: Ability to work independently and within a team environment.
- :check: Familiarity with eye care equipment and EMR systems.

### :gift: Benefits
- :check: Be a part of a reputed institution like Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute.
- :check: Competitive salary and performance-based incentives.
- :check: Opportunities for continuous learning and professional growth.
- :check: Collaborative and patient-centric work environment at Lotus Eye Hospital and Institute.
- :check: Access to modern diagnostic tools and technologies.

title: Optometrist
description:
## :scroll: Job Description
> This is a full-time, on-site role for an Optometrist based in Vijayawada. The Optometrist will be responsible for performing comprehensive eye examinations, diagnosing and treating visual issues, prescribing corrective lenses, and providing pre-operative and post-operative care for patients undergoing surgeries. The role also involves educating patients about eye health and collaborating with other healthcare professionals to ensure optimal patient care.

### :white_check_mark: Qualifications
- :check: Experience in conducting thorough eye examinations and prescribing corrective eyewear
- :check: Proficiency in diagnosing and managing eye diseases and conditions
- :check: Strong interpersonal skills for patient education and communication
- :check: Experience with pre-operative and post-operative eye care procedures
- :check: Attention to detail and a commitment to maintaining high standards in patient care
- :check: Ability to work effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team
- :check: Doctorate of Optometry (OD) or equivalent qualifications
- :check: Clinical experience in optometry practice is preferred

title: Optometrist
company: Sir H.N. Reliance Foundation Hospital & Research Centre
description:
## :scroll: Job Description

> Sir H. N. Reliance Foundation Hospital and Research Centre is a state-of-the-art 345 bed multi-specialty tertiary care hospital, situated in South Mumbai.

### :briefcase: Job Profile
- :check: Responsible for upkeep & calibration of all department equipment. Liaise with Biomedical Engineer to ensure smooth functioning of equipment.
- :check: Report any damage to instruments/equipment to the concerned Biomedical and follow up for replacement.
- :check: Assist / perform procedures or tests such as per the qualifications, clinical credentialing and experience.
- :check: Conduct detail optometry workup for all OPD, EHC & IPD patients.
- :check: Conduct OPD Procedures like Perimetry, OCT, Topography, IOL Master, Fundus Camera, FFA, A-Scan, B-Scan, Pachymetry, Specular microscopy.
- :check: Follow standard operating procedures including obtaining consent form, counselling the patient and safety checklist during all procedures/tests.
- :check: Support in transferring and positioning of the patient in OT on need basis.

### :pencil: Requirements
- :check: **Skills:** Clinical assessment, Prescription writing, Ocular health evaluation, Contact lens fitting, Visual acuity testing, Patient communication, Eye examination, Optical dispensing.
- :check: **Candidate Requirement:** Graduation or PG in Optometry, Basic computer and typing skills, Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

title: Optometrist (Optical Sales & Clinical Care)
description:
## :scroll: Job Description
> Responsibilities:

- :check: Conduct comprehensive eye examinations and vision tests for patients. Diagnose visual problems and prescribe corrective lenses (spectacles/contact lenses). Provide expert advice on lens types, frames, and optical products to customers. Assist in optical sales and ensure excellent customer service within the optical store. Maintain accurate patient records and prescriptions. Collaborate with ophthalmologists and hospital staff to ensure high-quality patient care. Ensure proper hygiene and maintenance of optical equipment.

> Qualifications:

- :check: Bachelor’s or Diploma in Optometry (recognized institution). Registered with the relevant Optometry Council. 1–3 years of experience in hospital or optical retail preferred. Strong communication and sales skills.

title: Optometrist
description:
## :scroll: Job Description
> Location: Muddenahalli, Chikkaballapur, Karnataka

> Experience: Minimum 2 years in a **hospital, vision center, or clinical eye care setting**

> Qualification: Bachelor's or Masters in Optometry

> Employment Type: Full-time | 6-day workweek

> Why Join Us?

> At SMSIMSR, vision care is an integral part of our approach to comprehensive and preventive healthcare. As an Optometrist, you will work alongside ophthalmologists and primary care providers to deliver diagnostic, therapeutic, and preventive eye care to patients across all age groups. This role requires strong clinical knowledge and excellent patient interaction skills.

> Key Responsibilities

- :check: Conduct vision tests, refraction, and prescribe corrective lenses. Diagnose common eye conditions like myopia, hyperopia, astigmatism, and presbyopia. Assist ophthalmologists in pre- and post-operative care, as well as screening for diseases like glaucoma or cataracts. Counsel patients on eye care, visual hygiene, contact lens use, and spectacle maintenance. Interpret diagnostic results from retinoscopy, tonometry, slit-lamp, and visual field tests. Maintain detailed patient records and documentation. Participate in community outreach eye screening camps as required. Recommend further referral to ophthalmologists for advanced medical or surgical management.

title: Optometerist
description:
## :scroll: Job Description
> Objective:

> An Optometrist may perform an eye exam and write a prescription for corrective lenses, while an optician may fill that prescription.

> The Optometrist plays a critical role in delivering high-quality eye care by conducting comprehensive eye examinations and providing personalized treatment recommendations. This position emphasizes patient-centered care, clinical accuracy, and professional judgment.

> Responsibilities:

- :check: Conduct comprehensive eye examinations including AR, NCT, refraction, vision assessment, and dilation. Clearly explain examination procedures and findings to patients in a professional and empathetic manner. Establish and maintain positive patient rapport throughout the visit. Accurately document and update patient medical history and clinical data. Provide evidence-based treatment recommendations, including prescriptions for spectacles, contact lenses, or referrals for surgery. Ensure consistent delivery of high-quality, patient-focused care through meticulous clinical practices.

> Requirements:

- :check: Strong communication and clinical skills with a patient-first approach. Proven ability to work collaboratively within a healthcare team. Confidence and proficiency in operating complex eye care diagnostic equipment. Commitment to ethical practice, integrity, discipline, and adherence to corporate norms.
